title: 2005–06 Yeovil Town F.C. season
text:
The <a href="2005%E2%80%9306%20in%20English%20football">2005–06 season</a> was the third season in <a href="the%20Football%20League">the Football League</a> and the first season at the third tier of English football played by <a href="Yeovil%20Town%20F.C.">Yeovil Town Football Club</a>, an English football club based in <a href="Yeovil">Yeovil</a>, Somerset.
Yeovil began their first campaign in <a href="Football%20League%20One">League One</a> with a run of six games without a win. After an upturn in form, manager <a href="Gary%20Johnson%20%28footballer%2C%20born%201955%29">Gary Johnson</a> left the club for West Country rivals <a href="Bristol%20City%20F.C.">Bristol City</a>. His assistant <a href="Steve%20Thompson%20%28footballer%2C%20born%201963%29">Steve Thompson</a> oversaw the rest of the campaign, inconsistent form plighted the season but even after the loss of <a href="Darren%20Way">Darren Way</a> and <a href="Lee%20Johnson%20%28footballer%29">Lee Johnson</a> in January, the club's League One status was confirmed with a game to spare.
The team reached the second round of the <a href="FA%20Cup">FA Cup</a> before losing 2–0 away at fellow League One side <a href="Walsall%20F.C.">Walsall</a>. The team also reached the second round of the <a href="Football%20League%20Cup">Football League Cup</a> knocking out <a href="Football%20League%20Championship">Championship</a> side <a href="Ipswich%20Town%20F.C.">Ipswich Town</a> before losing to <a href="Millwall%20F.C.">Millwall</a>, while in the <a href="Football%20League%20Trophy">Football League Trophy</a> the club were knocked by <a href="Leyton%20Orient%20F.C.">Leyton Orient</a> in the first round. Forward <a href="Phil%20Jevons">Phil Jevons</a> was the club's top goalscorer for the second consecutive season scoring 16 goals, with 15 in the league and one in the FA Cup.
Background.
The <a href="2004%E2%80%9305%20in%20English%20football">2004–05 season</a> was the club's second season in <a href="the%20Football%20League">the Football League</a> and manager <a href="Gary%20Johnson%20%28footballer%2C%20born%201955%29">Gary Johnson</a>'s fourth season in charge. The end of the season saw the team celebrate promotion from <a href="Football%20League%20Two">League Two</a> as champions. The club released five players including Latvian international <a href="Andrejs%20%C5%A0tolcers">Andrejs Štolcers</a> while Polish striker <a href="Bartosz%20Tarachulski">Bartosz Tarachulski</a> rejected the club's offer of a new contract.
Four further players were offered new contracts, <a href="Colin%20Miles">Colin Miles</a> agreeing a new one-year contract while <a href="Adam%20Lockwood">Adam Lockwood</a> agreed a month-to-month deal. Youngsters <a href="Stephen%20Reed%20%28footballer%29">Stephen Reed</a> and <a href="Dale%20Williams%20%28footballer%29">Dale Williams</a> both signed new one deals. Additionally player/assistant manager <a href="Steve%20Thompson%20%28footballer%2C%20born%201963%29">Steve Thompson</a> agreed a new two-year contract. While goalkeeper <a href="Daniel%20Barker%20%28footballer%29">Daniel Barker</a> and midfielder Richard Cullingford entered the <a href="Glossary%20of%20association%20football%20terms%23F">first team</a> squad from the <a href="Youth%20system">youth team</a> after agreeing their first professional contracts. The close season also saw manager Gary Johnson reject an approach from <a href="Football%20League%20Championship">Championship</a> side <a href="Derby%20County%20F.C.">Derby County</a>.
Review.
Pre-season.
The squad returned for pre-season training on 1 July. The first day of pre-season saw the arrival of four new signings, striker <a href="Matt%20Harrold">Matt Harrold</a> joined from <a href="Brentford%20F.C.">Brentford</a> for a nominal fee, while left-back <a href="Nathan%20Jones%20%28Welsh%20footballer%29">Nathan Jones</a> signed following his release from <a href="Brighton%20%26amp%3B%20Hove%20Albion%20F.C.">Brighton & Hove Albion</a>, winger <a href="David%20Poole%20%28footballer%29">David Poole</a> joined after his release from <a href="Manchester%20United%20F.C.">Manchester United</a>, and defender <a href="Luke%20Oliver">Luke Oliver</a> signed for an undisclosed five-figure sum from <a href="Football%20Conference">Conference</a> side <a href="Woking%20F.C.">Woking</a>.
On 5 July, Yeovil set off for their Dutch training base for a pre-season tour for three matches against German opposition. The squad was joined by a selection of trialists including former <a href="Arsenal%20F.C.">Arsenal</a> trainee <a href="Eric%20Obinna%20Chukwunyelu">Eric Obinna</a>. Yeovil's first friendly saw them record a 1–0 victory over <a href="Regionalliga%20Nord">Regionalliga Nord</a> side <a href="SC%20Preu%C3%9Fen%20M%C3%BCnster">SC Preußen Münster</a> courtesy of a <a href="Phil%20Jevons">Phil Jevons</a> penalty, Yeovil then faced the reserve team of <a href="Bayer%2004%20Leverkusen%20II">Bayer 04 Leverkusen</a> winning the match 2–1 with goals from <a href="Adam%20Lockwood">Adam Lockwood</a> and <a href="Lee%20Johnson%20%28footballer%29">Lee Johnson</a>. Yeovil concluded their tour with a 7–1 defeat against <a href="2.%20Bundesliga">2. Bundesliga</a> side <a href="Rot%20Weiss%20Ahlen">Leichtathletik Rasensport Ahlen</a> with Obinna scoring Yeovil's consolation goal, but that was the last contribution for Obinna as he was released upon Yeovil's return home. Upon the club's return, they briefly took former <a href="Nottingham%20Forest%20F.C.">Nottingham Forest</a> striker <a href="Craig%20Westcarr">Craig Westcarr</a> on trial, before their first home friendly of the season against <a href="Premier%20League">Premier League</a> side <a href="Portsmouth%20F.C.">Portsmouth</a>. Yeovil suffered a 4–2 defeat with <a href="Paul%20Terry%20%28footballer%29">Paul Terry</a> and <a href="Darren%20Way">Darren Way</a> scoring for the Glovers. The following day Yeovil traveled to <a href="Burgess%20Hill%20Town%20F.C.">Burgess Hill Town</a>, and a collection of squad players and trialists recorded a 4–0 victory with goals from <a href="Stephen%20Reed%20%28footballer%29">Stephen Reed</a>, <a href="David%20Poole%20%28footballer%29">David Poole</a>, <a href="Luke%20Oliver">Luke Oliver</a> and <a href="Scott%20Guyett">Scott Guyett</a>. In mid-July, young winger <a href="Dale%20Williams%20%28footballer%29">Dale Williams</a> received his first two <a href="Wales%20national%20under-19%20football%20team">Wales under-19</a> caps in friendlies against <a href="Turkey%20national%20under-19%20football%20team">Turkey</a>.
Yeovil then had two more friendly matches in consecutive days, first a 3–1 win against <a href="Dorchester%20Town%20F.C.">Dorchester Town</a> with goals from <a href="Kevin%20Gall">Kevin Gall</a>, Jevons and <a href="Matt%20Harrold">Matt Harrold</a>, followed by a trip to <a href="Staines%20Town%20F.C.">Staines Town</a> again winning 3–1 with goals from Terry, trialist Paul Bastin, who was later revealed to be <a href="Pablo%20Bastianini">Pablo Bastianini</a>, and Harrold. On 23 July, Yeovil hosted newly promoted Premier League <a href="West%20Ham%20United%20F.C.">West Ham United</a>, a game which saw the return of <a href="Gavin%20Williams%20%28footballer%29">Gavin Williams</a> who received his League Two winners medals before the match. A crowd of 8,382 watch Yeovil record a 2–2 draw with Bastianini and Gall scoring the Glovers' goals. Three days later Yeovil lost 3–1 at home against relegated Premier League side <a href="Southampton%20F.C.">Southampton</a>. The following day Yeovil travelled to face Conference side <a href="Woking%20F.C.">Woking</a>, for a benefit match for former manager Colin Lippiatt, the Glovers won the match 2–0 with goals from trialist <a href="Luciano%20%C3%81lvarez">Luciano Álvarez</a> and Poole. Yeovil's pre-season schedule concluded with a 1–1 draw against <a href="Cheltenham%20Town%20F.C.">Cheltenham Town</a> and a 3–0 win against <a href="Tiverton%20Town%20F.C.">Tiverton Town</a>.
After a successful trial Argentine striker Pablo Bastianini signed from <a href="Quilmes%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20Club">Quilmes</a> for an undisclosed club record fee, signing a two-year contract. With manager <a href="Gary%20Johnson%20%28footballer%2C%20born%201955%29">Gary Johnson</a>, saying of the fee, "we have signed him for a club record fee but that will remain undisclosed. All I can say is that it is not six figures which some people are presuming."
August.
Yeovil's season opener in their first season in <a href="Football%20League%20One">League One</a> saw them travel to <a href="Oldham%20Athletic%20A.F.C.">Oldham Athletic</a>, on 6 August. Without record signing <a href="Pablo%20Bastianini">Pablo Bastianini</a> whose international clearance had failed to come through Yeovil lost the match 2–0. On the same day a Yeovil Town XI side faced <a href="Sherborne%20Town%20F.C.">Sherborne Town</a> in a friendly match and recorded a 3–0 win with Argentine trialist <a href="Luciano%20%C3%81lvarez">Luciano Álvarez</a> scoring a brace and <a href="Dale%20Williams%20%28footballer%29">Dale Williams</a> with the third. On 9 August, defender <a href="Scott%20Guyett">Scott Guyett</a> joined Conference side <a href="Aldershot%20Town%20F.C.">Aldershot Town</a> on a one-month loan deal, that evening Yeovil drew 0–0 with <a href="Rotherham%20United%20F.C.">Rotherham United</a> in their first home match in League One. Following the match defender <a href="Adam%20Lockwood">Adam Lockwood</a> signed a new one-year contract, On 13 August, Yeovil drew 1–1 with <a href="Blackpool%20F.C.">Blackpool</a> with <a href="Kevin%20Amankwaah">Kevin Amankwaah</a> scoring Yeovil's first goal of the season. Young defender <a href="Stephen%20Reed%20%28footballer%29">Stephen Reed</a> joined <a href="Woking%20F.C.">Woking</a> on a short-term loan deal, while <a href="Arron%20Davies">Arron Davies</a> scored in a 3–1 victory for <a href="Wales%20national%20under-21%20football%20team">Wales under-21s</a> against <a href="Malta%20national%20under-21%20football%20team">Malta</a>. On 18 August, record signing Pablo Bastiaini finally received his international clearance, and the following day Yeovil signed a second Argentine, <a href="Luciano%20%C3%81lvarez">Luciano Álvarez</a> signing a four-month contract after a successful trial. Bastianini's debut though saw Yeovil lost 1–0 away at <a href="Barnsley%20F.C.">Barnsley</a> a result which saw Yeovil fall to the foot of the table. On 23 August, Yeovil faced <a href="Football%20League%20Championship">Championship</a> side <a href="Ipswich%20Town%20F.C.">Ipswich Town</a> in the first round of the <a href="Football%20League%20Cup">League Cup</a>. Yeovil recorded their first victory of the season with <a href="Darren%20Way">Darren Way</a> and <a href="Kevin%20Gall">Kevin Gall</a> both scoring in a 2–0 win. With the transfer deadline looming, Yeovil rejected a bid in the region of £100,000 from <a href="Swansea%20City%20A.F.C.">Swansea City</a> for the services of <a href="Lee%20Johnson%20%28footballer%29">Lee Johson</a>, while defender <a href="Michael%20Rose%20%28footballer%2C%20born%201982%29">Michael Rose</a> joined <a href="Cheltenham%20Town%20F.C.">Cheltenham Town</a> on a month's loan deal. but forward <a href="Kevin%20Gall">Kevin Gall</a> rejected a move to <a href="Carlisle%20United%20F.C.">Carlisle United</a> after the two club had agreed an unspecified fee. On 27 August, Yeovil lost 4–2 to <a href="Swindon%20Town%20F.C.">Swindon Town</a>, with Bastianini scoring his first goal for the club after just 26 seconds. Three days later Yeovil completed a winless month in the league, losing 3–1 at home to <a href="Chesterfield%20F.C.">Chesterfield</a> with Álvarez scoring his first Yeovil goal. Transfer deadline day saw Yeovil bring in <a href="Liam%20Fontaine">Liam Fontaine</a> on loan from <a href="Fulham%20F.C.">Fulham</a>, while <a href="Luke%20Oliver">Luke Oliver</a> returned to <a href="Woking%20F.C.">Woking</a> on loan, and Dale Williams joined <a href="Tiverton%20Town%20F.C.">Tiverton Town</a> on loan.
September.
Yeovil began September by recording their first League victory of the season, winning 1–0 away at <a href="Hartlepool%20United%20F.C.">Hartlepool United</a>, with <a href="Pablo%20Bastianini">Pablo Bastianini</a>'s header enough for victory. <a href="Arron%20Davies">Arron Davies</a> who missed the match appeared in two more matches for <a href="Wales%20under-21%20national%20football%20team">Wales under-21s</a>. On 10 September, Yeovil recorded their second successive win a 2–1 victory over <a href="Walsall%20F.C.">Walsall</a> to move off the foot of the table, with <a href="Phil%20Jevons">Phil Jevons</a> scoring his first goal of the season.
The following week saw the extension of <a href="Scott%20Guyett">Scott Guyett</a>'s loan at <a href="Aldershot%20Town%20F.C.">Aldershot Town</a> for a further month, the signing of Uruguayan defender <a href="Alejandro%20Melo%C3%B1o">Alejandro Meloño</a> on a short-term contract and the departure of <a href="Andy%20Lindegaard">Andy Lindegaard</a> on loan to <a href="Crawley%20Town%20F.C.">Crawley Town</a>. On 17 September, Yeovil drew 1–1 away at <a href="Bradford%20City%20A.F.C.">Bradford City</a>, while <a href="Stephen%20Reed%20%28footballer%29">Stephen Reed</a> having returned from his loan at <a href="Woking%20F.C.">Woking</a> was immediately sent out on loan to <a href="Aldershot%20Town%20F.C.">Aldershot Town</a>. Yeovil then faced <a href="Millwall%20F.C.">Millwall</a> in the second round of the League Cup, after being reduced to ten-men Yeovil were knocked out losing 2–1. The game turned out to be the last match at Yeovil for manager <a href="Gary%20Johnson%20%28footballer%2C%20born%201955%29">Gary Johnson</a>, who left the club to join West Country rivals <a href="Bristol%20City%20F.C.">Bristol City</a>. Johnson departed after four seasons in which he had overseen two promotions and victory in the <a href="FA%20Trophy">FA Trophy</a>. Johnson's assistant <a href="Steve%20Thompson%20%28footballer%2C%20born%201963%29">Steve Thompson</a> took over as caretaker boss and recorded a 1–0 victory in his first match in charge against <a href="Port%20Vale%20F.C.">Port Vale</a>, with summer signing <a href="Matt%20Harrold">Matt Harrold</a> scoring his first goal for the club. On 27 September, Yeovil travelled to <a href="Southend%20United%20F.C.">Southend United</a> and despite taking the lead courtesy of a Jevons free-kick ultimately lost 4–1. The end of September also saw Thompson bring in former Yeovil goalkeeper <a href="Len%20Bond">Len Bond</a> as the club's new goalkeeping coach.
October.
Yeovil started October with a trip to <a href="Scunthorpe%20United%20F.C.">Scunthorpe United</a> and after trailing 2–0 inside the first 20 minutes, Yeovil mounted a remarkable comeback to win the match 4–3 with goals from <a href="Darren%20Way">Darren Way</a>, <a href="Phil%20Jevons">Phil Jevons</a> and a brace from first-half substitute <a href="Matt%20Harrold">Matt Harrold</a>. That result was enough to convince the Yeovil board to appoint manager <a href="Steve%20Thompson%20%28footballer%2C%20born%201963%29">Steve Thompson</a> on a permanent basis. Thompson celebrated his permanent appointment with a 1–0 victory over league leaders <a href="Swansea%20City%20A.F.C.">Swansea City</a>, a result which saw Yeovil rise to eighth in the table. On 10 October, Yeovil appointed former <a href="Plymouth%20Argyle%20F.C.">Plymouth Argyle</a> manager <a href="Kevin%20Hodges">Kevin Hodges</a> as their new assistant manager to work with Steve Thompson. Yeovil then faced two away matches recording a goalless draw against <a href="Gillingham%20F.C.">Gillingham</a>, before losing 2–0 to <a href="Leyton%20Orient%20F.C.">Leyton Orient</a> in the first round of the <a href="Football%20League%20Trophy">Football League Trophy</a>. The Gillingham match saw midfielder Darren Way suffer a fractured cheekbone and eye socket that ruled him out for four weeks. On 20 October, Yeovil confirmed <a href="Andy%20Lindegaard">Andy Lindegaard</a> had extended his loan at <a href="Crawley%20Town%20F.C.">Crawley Town</a> for another month. On 22 October, Yeovil recorded an impressive a 3–0 win against <a href="Nottingham%20Forest%20F.C.">Nottingham Forest</a>, with Jevons scoring a brace. On 24 October, the club confirmed the departure of Uruguay <a href="Alejandro%20Melo%C3%B1o">Alejandro Meloño</a> after his contract terminated by mutual consent having only started two matches. Yeovil ended the month losing 3–2 away at <a href="Colchester%20United%20F.C.">Colchester United</a>.
November.
Yeovil needed a late goal from <a href="Phil%20Jevons">Phil Jevons</a> to salvage a replay in their <a href="FA%20Cup">FA Cup</a> first round match against <a href="Football%20League%20Two">League Two</a> side <a href="Macclesfield%20Town%20F.C.">Macclesfield Town</a>. After a series of injuries in central midfield, Yeovil signed <a href="West%20Ham%20United%20F.C.">West Ham United</a> midfielder <a href="Chris%20Cohen">Chris Cohen</a> on a month-loan deal, that was subsequently extended until the end of the season. Yeovil then suffered a 2–1 home defeat against <a href="Huddersfield%20Town%20A.F.C.">Huddersfield Town</a>, before on 15 November, Yeovil faced Macclesfield in their FA Cup first round replay and a goalscoring return of <a href="Darren%20Way">Darren Way</a> from injury led Yeovil to a 4–0 victory. On 18 November, full-back <a href="Adam%20Lockwood">Adam Lockwood</a> joined <a href="Torquay%20United%20F.C.">Torquay United</a> on a month's loan. Yeovil then suffered two defeats to end November losing 2–0 to <a href="Swansea%20City%20A.F.C.">Swansea City</a>, before losing by the same scoreline at home to <a href="Oldham%20Athletic%20A.F.C.">Oldham Athletic</a>. The Swansea match saw midfielder Darren Way suffer a recurrence of a shin injury that ruled him out until January. The end of the month saw young winger <a href="Dale%20Williams%20%28footballer%29">Dale Williams</a> join <a href="Newport%20County%20A.F.C.">Newport County</a> on loan, while <a href="Luke%20Oliver">Luke Oliver</a> returned from his loan at <a href="Woking%20F.C.">Woking</a>.
December.
On 3 December, Yeovil were knocked out of the <a href="FA%20Cup">FA Cup</a> in the second round by <a href="Walsall%20F.C.">Walsall</a>, losing 2–0. Yeovil then travelled to <a href="Brentford%20F.C.">Brentford</a>, where after being reduced to ten-men after the dismissal of goalkeeper <a href="Chris%20Weale">Chris Weale</a> lost the match 3–2. With the suspension of Weale and injury to third choice keeper <a href="Daniel%20Barker%20%28footballer%29">Daniel Barker</a>, saw Yeovil sign former <a href="S.L.%20Benfica">Benfica</a> goalkeeper Francisco Ramos on non-contract terms as cover. Yeovil then recorded back-to-back 2–1 victories, first away at <a href="Rotherham%20United%20F.C.">Rotherham United</a>, and then at home against <a href="Barnsley%20F.C.">Barnsley</a>. After the Barnsley match, Yeovil announced that Argentine striker <a href="Luciano%20%C3%81lvarez">Luciano Álvarez</a> had returned to Argentina after the club decided not to extend his contract. A late penalty from <a href="Phil%20Jevons">Phil Jevons</a> earned Yeovil a 1–1 draw against <a href="A.F.C.%20Bournemouth">Bournemouth</a> in the first of their Christmas fixtures, Yeovil then travelled to <a href="Tranmere%20Rovers%20F.C.">Tranmere Rovers</a> where despite taking the lead through another Jevons penalty the Glovers suffered a heavy 4–1 defeat. On 30 December, the club announced that former manager <a href="David%20Webb%20%28footballer%29">David Webb</a> had bought out Jon Goddard-Watts to become the majority shareholder and chief executive of the club, with John Fry remaining as chairman. New Year's Eve saw Yeovil welcome manager <a href="Gary%20Johnson%20%28footballer%2C%20born%201955%29">Gary Johnson</a> back to the club, as the Glovers drew 1–1 with his new club <a href="Bristol%20City%20F.C.">Bristol City</a>, ending the year in 18th place in the league table.
January.
The opening of the January transfer window saw Yeovil loan out <a href="Michael%20Rose%20%28footballer%2C%20born%201982%29">Michael Rose</a> to <a href="Scunthorpe%20United%20F.C.">Scunthorpe United</a> until the end of the season. Three goals from <a href="Phil%20Jevons">Phil Jevons</a> were enough for Yeovil to record back-to-back victories to begin January, 1–0 away at <a href="Doncaster%20Rovers%20F.C.">Doncaster Rovers</a>, and 2–0 at home to <a href="Hartlepool%20United%20F.C.">Hartlepool United</a>. On 7 January, Nigerian international defender <a href="Efe%20Sodje">Efe Sodje</a> left the club for <a href="Southend%20United%20F.C.">Southend United</a> for an undisclosed fee. Subsequently, on 11 January, midfielder <a href="Lee%20Johnson%20%28footballer%29">Lee Johnson</a> also left the club for <a href="Scottish%20Premier%20League">Scottish Premier League</a> side <a href="Heart%20of%20Midlothian%20F.C.">Heart of Midlothian</a> for £50,000. On 14 January, Yeovil drew 1–1 with <a href="Milton%20Keynes%20Dons%20F.C.">Milton Keynes Dons</a>. Subsequently, Yeovil announced the signing of new owner <a href="David%20Webb%20%28footballer%29">David Webb</a>'s son, <a href="Daniel%20Webb%20%28footballer%29">Daniel</a> on an 18-month contract. On 20 January, midfielder <a href="Darren%20Way">Darren Way</a> left the club, after a bid of £150,000 from <a href="Swansea%20City%20A.F.C.">Swansea City</a> was accepted. Yeovil's final match of January saw them lose 1–0 at home to <a href="Bradford%20City%20A.F.C.">Bradford City</a>. The end of the month saw the club award youth team graduate <a href="Gavin%20McCallum">Gavin McCallum</a> his first professional contract, the <a href="Canada%20men%27s%20national%20under-20%20soccer%20team">Canada under-20</a> international signing an 18-month deal. The club also announced the departure of defender <a href="Luke%20Oliver">Luke Oliver</a> to <a href="Stevenage%20F.C.">Stevenage Borough</a> for a fee of £15,000. The end of the transfer window saw Yeovil complete three signings, former Jamaica under-23 defender <a href="Bradley%20Thomas%20%28footballer%29">Bradley Thomas</a> signed from <a href="Eastleigh%20F.C.">Eastleigh</a> on a free transfer, <a href="Accrington%20Stanley%20F.C.">Accrington Stanley</a> midfielder <a href="Anthony%20Barry%20%28footballer%29">Anthony Barry</a> for an undisclosed fee, and former <a href="Derby%20County%20F.C.">Derby County</a> defender <a href="Jamie%20Vincent">Jamie Vincent</a> on a short-term contract.
February.
Yeovil began February with consecutive defeats first a 2–0 loss at home against <a href="Southend%20United%20F.C.">Southend United</a>, and then followed with a 1–0 loss away at <a href="Port%20Vale%20F.C.">Port Vale</a>. On 14 February, a dramatic equaliser in the third minute of injury time gave rock-bottom <a href="Milton%20Keynes%20Dons%20F.C.">Milton Keynes Dons</a> a 1–1 draw against Yeovil. On 20 February, owner <a href="David%20Webb%20%28footballer%29">David Webb</a> decided to step down as Yeovil's chief executive, and decided not to join the board of directors. A third defeat of the month saw Yeovil slip into the relegation zone for the first time since September, as the club lost 2–0 away at <a href="Blackpool%20F.C.">Blackpool</a>.
March.
The start of March, saw Yeovil confirm the signing of Northern Irish international midfielder <a href="Tommy%20Doherty">Tommy Doherty</a> on loan from <a href="Queens%20Park%20Rangers%20F.C.">Queens Park Rangers</a> on a one-month loan deal, while <a href="Stephen%20Reed%20%28footballer%29">Stephen Reed</a> joined <a href="Torquay%20United%20F.C.">Torquay United</a> on loan until the end of the season. A hat-trick from Welsh attacking midfielder <a href="Arron%20Davies">Arron Davies</a> earned Yeovil a 3–0 victory away at <a href="Chesterfield%20F.C.">Chesterfield</a>, on 4 March, to record their first win in seven matches and move out of the relegation zone. The Chesterfield match though saw Yeovil suffer injuries to both Doherty and <a href="Anthony%20Barry%20%28footballer%29">Anthony Barry</a> who was ruled out for the rest of the season with a dislocated knee. After an injury to <a href="Chris%20Weale">Chris Weale</a>, Francisco Ramos returned to the club as goalkeeper cover for the club's trip to <a href="Brentford%20F.C.">Brentford</a>, but Yeovil lost the match 2–1. In an attempt to ease the club's injury crisis, Yeovil signed Irish midfielder <a href="Marc%20Wilson%20%28Irish%20footballer%29">Marc Wilson</a> on loan from <a href="Portsmouth%20F.C.">Portsmouth</a> for a month and goalkeeper <a href="Michael%20Jordan%20%28footballer%29">Michael Jordan</a> on loan from <a href="Arsenal%20F.C.">Arsenal</a> until the end of the season. On 11 March, Yeovil drew 0–0 with relegation rivals <a href="Swindon%20Town%20F.C.">Swindon Town</a>, in the week following the match the club confirmed that <a href="Jamie%20Vincent">Jamie Vincent</a> had joined <a href="Millwall%20F.C.">Millwall</a> on loan until the end of the season. While club record signing <a href="Pablo%20Bastianini">Pablo Bastianini</a> had left the club after having his contract terminated by mutual consent. On 18 March, Yeovil suffered a 1–0 defeat away at <a href="A.F.C.%20Bournemouth">Bournemouth</a>, before bouncing back with a comfortable 2–0 victory over <a href="Walsall%20F.C.">Walsall</a> with goals from <a href="Matt%20Harrold">Matt Harrold</a> and Arron Davies. On 23 March, Yeovil completed the loan signings of <a href="Craig%20Rocastle">Craig Rocastle</a> from <a href="Sheffield%20Wednesday%20F.C.">Sheffield Wednesday</a> and midfielder Sam Alsop from <a href="Birmingham%20City%20F.C.">Birmingham City</a>. Yeovil ended March with a 2–2 draw against <a href="Tranmere%20Rovers%20F.C.">Tranmere Rovers</a> after twice having the lead courtesy of Matt Harrold.
April and May.
On 1 April, Yeovil travelled to West Country rivals <a href="Bristol%20City%20F.C.">Bristol City</a> where a goal from <a href="Arron%20Davies">Arron Davies</a> was only a consolation in a 2–1 defeat. Yeovil then boosted their survival hopes with a 3–0 victory over <a href="Doncaster%20Rovers%20F.C.">Doncaster Rovers</a> with goals from <a href="Terry%20Skiverton">Terry Skiverton</a>, <a href="Phil%20Jevons">Phil Jevons</a> and Arron Davies. On 14 April, Yeovil suffered a 1–0 home defeat against <a href="Scunthorpe%20United%20F.C.">Scunthorpe United</a>, the game saw goalkeeper <a href="Chris%20Weale">Chris Weale</a> suffer a serious anterior cruciate ligament injury which ruled him out until at least December 2006. Yeovil took the lead through an early Phil Jevons free-kick away at <a href="Nottingham%20Forest%20F.C.">Nottingham Forest</a> but the Reds fought back to condemn Yeovil to a 2–1 defeat. Yeovil's penultimate home fixture of the season saw the visit of <a href="Gillingham%20F.C.">Gillingham</a>. After falling behind, Yeovil scored four goals without reply through a Jevons penalty, <a href="Chris%20Cohen">Chris Cohen</a>'s first goal for the club, <a href="Paul%20Terry%20%28footballer%29">Paul Terry</a> and Arron Davies, and despite a late fightback Yeovil held on for a 4–3 victory. A second half fightback in Yeovil's final away match of the season against promotion chasing <a href="Huddersfield%20Town%20F.C.">Huddersfield Town</a>, saw Yeovil confirm their League One status, thanks to a brace from topscorer Phil Jevons. Yeovil's final match of the season saw them welcome second place <a href="Colchester%20United%20F.C.">Colchester United</a>, having already confirmed their safety Yeovil earned a credible 0–0 draw to finish the season in 15th position. The match also saw the club give youth team graduate <a href="Dale%20Williams%20%28footballer%29">Dale Williams</a> his professional debut.
Summary and aftermath.
After a sluggish start to the season, Yeovil's form recovered even after the departure of manager <a href="Gary%20Johnson%20%28footballer%2C%20born%201955%29">Gary Johnson</a> in September, and confirmed their League One safety with one match to spare. In the league the team won 8 matches, drew 8 and lost 7 at home, compared to winning 7, drawing 3 and losing 13 away from home. <a href="Matt%20Harrold">Matt Harrold</a> and <a href="Nathan%20Jones%20%28Welsh%20footballer%29">Nathan Jones</a> recorded the highest number of appearances during the season, appearing in 48 of Yeovil's 51 matches. <a href="Phil%20Jevons">Phil Jevons</a> was Yeovil's top scorer for the second season in succession with 16 goals each, with 15 those coming in the league.
The end of the season saw a major turnover of players with <a href="Steve%20Thompson%20%28footballer%2C%20born%201963%29">Steve Thompson</a> initially releasing four players Richard Cullingford, <a href="Kevin%20Gall">Kevin Gall</a>, <a href="Stephen%20Reed%20%28footballer%29">Stephen Reed</a> and <a href="Michael%20Rose%20%28footballer%2C%20born%201982%29">Michael Rose</a>. Despite Thompson wanting to offer him a contract young winger <a href="Dale%20Williams%20%28footballer%29">Dale Williams</a> was allowed to leave by Chairman John Fry. Having not appeared for the club since his signing in January, <a href="Jamie%20Vincent">Jamie Vincent</a> was also released. Goalkeeper <a href="Steve%20Collis">Steve Collis</a> was also allowed to leave the club having not been offered a contract, while both <a href="Chris%20Weale">Chris Weale</a> and top-scorer Phil Jevons were reunited with former manager Gary Johnson at <a href="Bristol%20City%20F.C.">Bristol City</a> after rejecting new contracts. Defender <a href="Adam%20Lockwood">Adam Lockwood</a> and <a href="Colin%20Miles">Colin Miles</a> also both rejected new contract offers and left the club. Captain <a href="Terry%20Skiverton">Terry Skiverton</a> agreed a one-year contract extension until the summer of 2008, and defender <a href="Scott%20Guyett">Scott Guyett</a> and midfielders <a href="Andy%20Lindegaard">Andy Lindegaard</a> and <a href="Paul%20Terry%20%28footballer%29">Paul Terry</a> all agreed new one-year contracts. The club also handed professional deals to three members of their under-18 title winning side <a href="Craig%20Alcock">Craig Alcock</a>, <a href="Thomas%20Clarke%20%28footballer%29">Thomas Clarke</a> and Jake Smeeton.
Despite successfully avoiding relegation, manager Steve Thompson was demoted by chairman John Fry back to his previous post of assistant, as the club hired former <a href="Grimsby%20Town%20F.C.">Grimsby Town</a> manager <a href="Russell%20Slade">Russell Slade</a> as their new manager, on a three-year contract, with <a href="Kevin%20Hodges">Kevin Hodges</a> leaving the club. Slade's arrival also saw the appointment of John Milton as the club's new football general manager. Physio Glen Schmidt also left the club to join Johnson at Bristol City. The summer also saw Chairman John Fry purchase <a href="David%20Webb%20%28footballer%29">David Webb</a>'s 92% share in the club for a significant, although undisclosed sum, to become majority shareholder at the club as well as chairman and chief executive.
The off-season also saw <a href="Arron%20Davies">Arron Davies</a> make his full international debut for <a href="Wales%20national%20football%20team">Wales</a> in a friendly against <a href="Trinidad%20and%20Tobago%20national%20football%20team">Trinidad and Tobago</a>, after receiving his first cap Davies agreed a new two-year contract with Yeovil.
